title: (x) "Double J Lawn Service" plastic model tree font - Tucson Two Step {Mike F}
content:
Odd title, but I’ve come across a font that looks like a tree from those plastic models. Has anyone seen this before?

Trying to attach, but keep getting this error.  
File copy failed: no directory configured, or it could not be accessed.
author: evan

comments.content:
That’d be Nick Curtis’ [Tucson Two Step](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005408/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/curtis/pages/t.htm).

The inspiration was a luggage sticker from a Tucson Hotel per Nick’s ReadMe. Thanks to Sander de Voogt’s [archive of all things Nick](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005408/http:/home.planet.nl/~voogt053/), we can read these references any time and, for some fonts, even see images of the [original material](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005408/http:/home.planet.nl/~voogt053/Pics/TucsonTwoStep.jpg).

I give up, I just give up…

Mike, how can you be so incredibly good!?!

Nice of you to say that, Yves, but every time you incredible guys ID a text face I know exactly where I stand on the skill ladder. My little niche here concerns the stuff that’s fallen by the wayside - often for good reason (but I do like this little gem. I just wish it had been made with one case free of the rails and posts).

I guess that’s the strength of this Board — everybody has his/her area of expertise, and I suppose we all occasionaly get blown away whenever something gets identified that is _not_ in our own personal niche.
Rarely do you guys miss. I am always impressed. Thanks again.
